item.name: ZFS ARC stat "$1"
item.description: arc_meta_used = hdr_size + metadata_size + dbuf_size + dnode_size + bonus_size

discovery_rule.name: Zfs Dataset discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discover ZFS dataset. Dataset names must contain a "/" else it's a zpool.

trigger_prototype.name: More than {$ZFS_AVERAGE_ALERT}% used on dataset {#FILESETNAME} on {HOST.NAME}

dependency.name: More than {$ZFS_HIGH_ALERT}% used on dataset {#FILESETNAME} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.name: More than {$ZFS_DISASTER_ALERT}% used on dataset {#FILESETNAME} on {HOST.NAME}
More than {$ZFS_HIGH_ALERT}% used on dataset {#FILESETNAME} on {HOST.NAME}

dependency.name: More than {$ZFS_DISASTER_ALERT}% used on dataset {#FILESETNAME} on {HOST.NAME}

item_prototype.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} scrub status
item_prototype.description:
Detect if the pool is currently scrubbing itself.
This is not a bad thing itself, but it slows down the entire pool and should be terminated when on production server during business hours if it causes a noticeable slowdown.

trigger_prototype.name: More than {$ZPOOL_AVERAGE_ALERT}% used on zpool {#POOLNAME} on {HOST.NAME}

dependency.name: More than {$ZPOOL_HIGH_ALERT}% used on zpool {#POOLNAME} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.name: More than {$ZPOOL_DISASTER_ALERT}% used on zpool {#POOLNAME} on {HOST.NAME}
More than {$ZPOOL_HIGH_ALERT}% used on zpool {#POOLNAME} on {HOST.NAME}

dependency.name: More than {$ZPOOL_DISASTER_ALERT}% used on zpool {#POOLNAME} on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} is scrubbing for more than 12h on {HOST.NAME}

dependency.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} is scrubbing for more than 24h on {HOST.NAME}

trigger_prototype.name: Zpool {#POOLNAME} is scrubbing for more than 24h on {HOST.NAME}

item_prototype.name: vdev {#VDEV}: CHECKSUM error counter
item_prototype.description:
This device has experienced an unrecoverable error. Determine if the device needs to be replaced.
If yes, use 'zpool replace' to replace the device.
If not, clear the error with 'zpool clear'.

item_prototype.name: vdev {#VDEV}: READ error counter
item_prototype.description:
This device has experienced an unrecoverable error. Determine if the device needs to be replaced.
If yes, use 'zpool replace' to replace the device.
If not, clear the error with 'zpool clear'.

item_prototype.name: vdev {#VDEV}: WRITE error counter
item_prototype.description:
This device has experienced an unrecoverable error. Determine if the device needs to be replaced.
If yes, use 'zpool replace' to replace the device.
If not, clear the error with 'zpool clear'.

item_prototype.name: vdev {#VDEV}: total number of errors
item_prototype.description:
This device has experienced an unrecoverable error. Determine if the device needs to be replaced.
If yes, use 'zpool replace' to replace the device.
If not, clear the error with 'zpool clear'.

trigger_prototype.name: vdev {#VDEV} has encountered {ITEM.VALUE} errors on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description:
This device has experienced an unrecoverable error. Determine if the device needs to be replaced.
If yes, use 'zpool replace' to replace the device.
If not, clear the error with 'zpool clear'.
You may also run a zpool scrub to check if some other undetected errors are present on this vdev.

trigger.name: Version of ZoL is now {ITEM.VALUE} on {HOST.NAME}
ZFS ARC dnode size > 90% dnode max size on {HOST.NAME}
ZFS ARC meta size > {$ZFS_ARC_META_ALERT}% meta max size on {HOST.NAME}
